document.body:
The #1 Independent Online Job Application Resource Website
Home » Fast Food Restaurant Jobs »Jack in the Box
Jack In The Box Application
Jack in the Box Application Online–Print Job Employment Form
Apply for Jobs at Jack In The Box Online
Application for Jack In The Box: Jack In The Box does not provide a printable job application. If you want to get a job at Jack In The Box, you must apply for employment on the website by following the link above. Full-time or part-time positions may vary depending on the location.
Interview Tips: Go to the Jack In The Box job interview questions&tips page.
Available Positions at Jack In The Box: Team Member, Team Leader, Assistant Manager, Restaurant Manager, Area Coach, Corporate Communications Internship, Research and Development Intern, Operations Support Manager, Relief Driver, Performance Effectiveness Consultant, Supply Chain Systems Analyst, Equipment Technician, Budget Analyst, Temporary Restaurant Inspector, Administrative Coordinator, Food Service Packer
Minimum Age to Work at Jack In The Box : 16 years old (How old do you have to be to work at Jack In The Box?)
Jack In The Box Hours of Operation: Hours vary by location; Typically open 24 hours a day, 7 days a week
More Information: Jack In The Box Job Info Related Jobs :

White Castle Unwind exciting employment opportunities in the fast food restaurant industry when you fill out the Jack in the Box application. Find work to pay the bills or begin a lasting career in foodservice or management. Apply online with Jack in the Box and end your employment search today.
Job Opportunities at Jack in the Box
Spring into action with the Jack in the Box application and discover a wealth of meaningful employment opportunities in the fast food restaurant industry today. Entry-level fast food jobs and full-time careers featuring outstanding pay and job benefits provide exciting work opportunities to applicants 16 and over. Complete the Jack in the Box employment application to begin the hiring process today.
Known for delicious food and a fun atmosphere, Jack in the Box also provides an exciting place to work. Jack in the Box jobs feature competitive base pay and salary options, flexible work schedules, and paid training opportunities. Apply online to learn more about Jack in the Box jobs.
Jack in the Box needs to hire team members now. Team members provide customer service and prepare food at Jack in the Box locations. Team members may advance into team leader positions with more pay and the opportunity to access employment benefits. Careers in management also provide workers full-time job opportunities. Jack in the Box home offices offer careers in IT, marketing, accounting, financing, consulting, distribution, legal, and human resources, as well.
Meaningful employment opportunities may rest only an application form away. Fill out the Jack in the Box job application and land the job of your dreams today. Apply online to find Jack in the Box locations hiring now. Submit the Jack in the Box online application form immediately.
Jack in the Box Job Titles and Salary Information Jack in the Box offers job hunters exciting opportunities in the fast-casual dining industry. Hiring both part-time and full-time workers, Jack in the Box needs entry-level employees and career-minded professionals to staff a number of positions now. Apply online to find more information on Jack in the Box job opportunities. Jack in the Box regularly hires individuals for the following positions:
Team Member – An entry-level job title, Jack in the Box team member greet customers, take orders, prepare food, operate cash registers, and keep workstations clean and organized. Jack in the Box team members must possess friendly, attentive, and courteous attitudes. Team member pay generally starts at minimum wage.
Management – Available in team leader, assistant manager, and store manager capacities, managerial roles at Jack in the Box locations offer career-minded applicants 18 and over the perfect opportunity for full-time employment. Team leaders supervise employees and create work schedules. Assistant managers and store managers hire and train new employees, delegate work, oversee operations at store locations, and ensure customer satisfaction. Management jobs may require a high school diploma or the equivalent. Team leaders generally earn around $10 an hour. Assistant managers receive salary options between $35,000 and $45,000 per year. Store managers may make in excess of $55,000 a year, depending on location and experience.
Applicants seeking employment opportunities other than entry-level service jobs and careers in management might find Jack in the Box corporate vacancies. Work as an operations support manager, a performance effectiveness consultant, a supply chain systems analyst, or a budget technician. Other career opportunities include equipment technician, budget analyst, food service packer, and administrative coordinator jobs. Apply online to discover more exciting career opportunities at Jack in the Box today.
Jack in the Box Work Benefits Aside from discounts on Jack in the Box food, both part-time and full-time employees enjoy job benefits , like a fast-paced, fun, and exciting work environment, paid training opportunities, and career growth potential. Jack in the Box jobs also feature flexible work schedules and competitive pay scales. Attractive salary options and exceptional base pay provide associates ample compensation.
In addition to pay scales and job perks, qualified associates also receive several work benefits. Jack in the Box employee benefits include future planning benefits, such as 401(k) retirement plans and pension plans, as well as insurance coverage and work-life benefits. Apply online to learn more about Jack in the Box employment benefits today.
Read more about Jack in the Box benefits .
Jack in the Box Application Video:
History Founder Robert O. Patterson opened the first Jack in the Box location in San Diego, California, in 1951. Over the next 7 years, Patterson experienced substantial success and opened 13 more locations in the greater San Diego area. After opening several locations in Arizona and throughout California, Jack in the Box celebrated its 100th location in 1969. By 1979, Jack in the Box operated more than 1,000 locations on the East and West Coast. Jack in the Box acquired Qdoba, a Mexican-American quick-service chain, in 2003.
Menu Jack in the Box operates standalone quick-service restaurants throughout the United States. The fast food restaurant chain features dine-in and carry-out services and offers drive-thru capabilities at most locations. The Jack in the Box menu includes typical Americana fast-food fare, such as burgers, fries, sandwiches, and salads. Jack in the Box also offers snacks and sides, desserts, hot and cold beverages, and breakfast food.
Community Involvement As a major quick-service food chain, Jack in the Box helps out the community. In 1998, Jack in the Box established The Jack in the Box Foundation, a non-profit organization designed to help mentor youths. Jack in the Box also regularly partners with Big Brothers Big Sisters and helps raise money and awareness for a number of other socially relevant causes.
Environmental Environmental accountability plays an important role in Jack in the Box business plan. In addition to adhering to strict environmental guidelines, Jack in the Box also helps promote animal welfare and raises all animals through safe and humane methods. Jack in the Box also participates in recycling programs. Jack in the Box continues to use recycled materials and energy saving procedures to promote environmental sustainability.
Planned Expansion Jack in the Box operates over 2,200 locations in 19 U.S. states. While the company announced no international expansion plans as of June 2011, Jack in the Box continues to expand domestically and plans to open new locations throughout the United States soon. Some areas of planned expansion include the East Coast and the Southwest.
Financial Operating as a public company, Jack in the Box trades on the NASDAQ under the stock ticker JACK. Formally known as Jack in the Box Inc., the fast-casual restaurant chain acquired Qdoba restaurants in 2003. Qdoba operates over 500 stores in 43 U.S. states. Jack in the Box generates over $2.6 billion in annual revenues and employs roughly 42,500 entry-level workers and full-time professional associates nationwide. Company headquarters operate from San Diego, California. 17 comments: Gordon:
Does Jack in the Box have employee discounts like free food, discounts for family members, lifetime discounts, stuff like that. I love the food so much it would be so cool to get those perks just for working there.
Zachary Thompson:

Samatha:

I believe this would open the doors for me to become a much better and more positive person making a difference in myself and working with others. I hope to receive a call or be offered a position with a Jack in the Box franchise. Thank you.
Sincerely,
Samatha Mesquite TX
